page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Now children still do chores and help out,but they goto bed a lot later. There were'nt a lot of shops in the village at this time. There was a spice shop (sweet shop),butchers and grocers. Most shops in 1930-40 were along the main road which is called Marshland Road. In the grocers in Moorends, a loaf of bread would have cost two pence ha'penny (just under one pence) now a loaf costs thirty nine pence. Dutchmen came to cut the peat on the moors. Most people used peat for fuel. Then coal was discovered so the Dutch workers helped to sink the first coal pit. Six people were killed doing this. One man slipped from the top of the shaft and was killed because someone stole his clogs so he had to go to work in shoes. There was also flooding in the pit.
